article.headline: Louisville 76, Bellarmine 64
article.story: LOUISVILLE, Ky. (AP) -- Terrence Williams and Juan Palacios led Louisville with 16 points each to defeat the Bellarmine Knights 76-64 in Sunday's second game of the NABC Classic. Williams also had 12 rebounds. Dzaflo Larkai and Matt Otte led the Knights with 14 points each. Larkai fouled out with 1:40 left. The game looked like it might become a blowout as the Cardinals (5-2) scored the first six points of the game against the Division II Knights. The Knights threatened to make a game of it when Larkai made a layup trimming the Cardinals' lead to 15-12. Louisville went on a 12-2 run, to make the score 27-14 with 8:31 left in the first half. The Knights (3-5) would get as close as four before halftime but trailed at the break 37-32. The closest Bellarmine would get in the second half was after an Otte 3-pointer made the score 52-46 with 13:18 left. Louisville got its largest lead, 62-48, after a layup by freshman Derrick Caracter, with 9:13 remaining. Louisville made a better percentage of 3-pointers (46) than free throws (27) in the first half. The Cardinals made 14-of-27 free throws for 52 percent. Marcus Flynn led Bellarmine with nine rebounds and made all four of his free throw attempts, the only free throws the Knights took. Scott Davenport is in his second year as Bellarmine's head coach and was an assistant at Louisville for nine years. Ohio beat St. Joseph's in the earlier Classic game, 79-72. The Cardinals beat the Hawks and Bobcats in their other two games of the Classic. Bellarmine lost to both.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
